title: Key-avoidance for alternating sign matrices
authors: Mathilde Bouvel, Rebecca Smith, Jessica Striker
abstract:
We initiate a systematic study of key-avoidance on alternating sign matrices
(ASMs) defined via pattern-avoidance on an associated permutation called the
\emph{key} of an ASM. We enumerate alternating sign matrices whose key avoids a
given set of permutation patterns in several instances. We show that ASMs whose
key avoids $231$ are permutations, thus any known enumeration for a set of
permutation patterns including $231$ extends to ASMs. We furthermore enumerate
by the Catalan numbers ASMs whose key avoids both $312$ and $321$. We also show
ASMs whose key avoids $312$ are in bijection with the gapless monotone
triangles of [Ayyer, Cori, Gouyou-Beauchamps 2011]. Thus key-avoidance
generalizes the notion of $312$-avoidance studied there. Finally, we enumerate
ASMs with a given key avoiding $312$ and $321$ using a connection to Schubert
polynomials, thereby deriving an interesting Catalan identity.
